title: Chinese Restaurant font
content:
I am looking for the kind of font that one might find in a Chinese Restaurant menu or signage. Any tips appreciated.

Thanks,

Lee
author: Lee H

comments.content:
_\> [www.dafont.com/theme.php?cat=201](http://web.archive.org/web/20150306193802/http:/www.dafont.com/theme.php?cat=201)_ :)

One word though: C-L-I-C-H-É.

_( You may want to consider some nice brushed scripts, as an alternate, maybe.  
Ala [SudTipos](http://web.archive.org/web/20150306193802/http:/www.sudtipos.com/), or [TypeSETit](http://web.archive.org/web/20150306193802/http:/www.typesetit.com/). )_

Dav

Dav:

Thanks man. Yes, I appreciate the cliche, but I am trying to recreate some existing signage, so I am merely paying homage to someone else's cliche . . . Thanks again.

Lee

If you are recreating existing signage you may want to post a sample image / photo of these signs, maybe someone on Typophile would be able to match / ID the previous typeface?

Dav

[Mandarin](http://web.archive.org/web/20150306193802/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/ef/mandarin/) is a classic in this category, but Solotype's [Buddha](http://web.archive.org/web/20150306193802/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/solotype/buddha/) has at least got lower-case characters.
